sentences.zh: 趙氏之先，與秦共祖。

translations.text: The ancestors of the Zhao clan shared a common origin with Qin.

sentences.zh: 至中衍，為帝大戊御。

translations.text: Down to Zhongyan, who served as charioteer to Emperor Da Jia.

sentences.zh: 其後世蜚廉有子二人，而命其一子曰惡來，事紂，為周所殺，其後為秦。

translations.text: In later generations, Fei Lian had two sons, and he named one son E Lai, who served King Zhou and was killed by Zhou. His descendants became Qin.

sentences.zh: 惡來弟曰季勝，其後為趙。

translations.text: E Lai's younger brother was called Ji Sheng, and his descendants became Zhao.

The ancestors of the Zhao clan shared a common origin with Qin. Down to Zhongyan, who served as charioteer to Emperor Da Jia. In later generations, Fei Lian had two sons, and he named one son E Lai, who served King Zhou and was killed by Zhou. His descendants became Qin. E Lai's younger brother was called Ji Sheng, and his descendants became Zhao.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.text: Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.text: Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou and was called Zhai Gao Lang.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.text: Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu, Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu.

sentences.zh: 造父幸於周繆王。

translations.text: Zao Fu was favored by King Mu of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 造父取驥之乘匹，與桃林盜驪、驊騮、綠耳，獻之繆王。

translations.text: Zao Fu obtained the finest horses from Ji, along with the Peach Forest stallions Li, Hua Liu, and Lu Er, and presented them to King Mu.

sentences.zh: 繆王使造父御，西巡狩，見西王母，樂之忘歸。

translations.text: King Mu had Zao Fu drive the chariot on a western inspection tour where he met the Queen Mother of the West and was so delighted he forgot to return.

sentences.zh: 而徐偃王反，繆王日馳千里馬，攻徐偃王，大破之。

translations.text: Then King Xu of Xu rebelled, so King Mu raced a thousand li in one day to attack King Xu of Xu and greatly defeated him.

sentences.zh: 乃賜造父以趙城，由此為趙氏。

translations.text: He then granted Zao Fu the city of Zhao, and from this came the Zhao clan.

Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng. Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou and was called Zhai Gao Lang. Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu, Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu. Zao Fu was favored by King Mu of Zhou. Zao Fu obtained the finest horses from Ji, along with the Peach Forest stallions Li, Hua Liu, and Lu Er, and presented them to King Mu. King Mu had Zao Fu drive the chariot on a western inspection tour where he met the Queen Mother of the West and was so delighted he forgot to return. Then King Xu of Xu rebelled, so King Mu raced a thousand li in one day to attack King Xu of Xu and greatly defeated him. He then granted Zao Fu the city of Zhao, and from this came the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 自造父已下六世至奄父，曰公仲，周宣王時伐戎，為御。

translations.text: From Zao Fu down six generations to Yan Fu, called Gong Zhong. During King Xuan of Zhou's time, he campaigned against the Rong and served as charioteer.

sentences.zh: 及千畝戰，奄父脫宣王。

translations.text: At the battle of Qian Mu, Yan Fu rescued King Xuan.

sentences.zh: 奄父生叔帶。

translations.text: Yan Fu gave birth to Shu Dai.

sentences.zh: 叔帶之時，周幽王無道，去周如晉，事晉文侯，始建趙氏于晉國。

translations.text: During Shu Dai's time, King You of Zhou was tyrannical, so he left Zhou and went to Jin, serving Marquis Wen of Jin, and first established the Zhao clan in Jin.

From Zao Fu down six generations to Yan Fu, called Gong Zhong. During King Xuan of Zhou's time, he campaigned against the Rong and served as charioteer. At the battle of Qian Mu, Yan Fu rescued King Xuan. Yan Fu gave birth to Shu Dai. During Shu Dai's time, King You of Zhou was tyrannical, so he left Zhou and went to Jin, serving Marquis Wen of Jin, and first established the Zhao clan in Jin.

sentences.zh: 自叔帶以下，趙宗益興，五世而（生）［至］趙夙。

translations.text: From Shu Dai downward, the Zhao lineage grew increasingly prominent, and after five generations came Zhao Su.
From Shu Dai downward, the Zhao lineage grew increasingly prominent, and after five generations came Zhao Su.

sentences.zh: 趙夙，晉獻公之十六年伐霍、魏、耿，而趙夙為將伐霍。

translations.text: Zhao Su, in the sixteenth year of Duke Xian of Jin, attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng, and Zhao Su served as general attacking Huo.

sentences.zh: 霍公求奔齊。

translations.text: The Lord of Huo fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 晉大旱，卜之，曰「霍太山為祟」。

translations.text: Jin suffered a great drought, they divined it, saying 'Mount Tai of Huo is causing the trouble.'

sentences.zh: 使趙夙召霍君於齊，復之，以奉霍太山之祀，晉復穰。

translations.text: They had Zhao Su summon the Lord of Huo from Qi and restore him, to maintain the sacrifices to Mount Tai of Huo, and Jin again became fertile.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公賜趙夙耿。

translations.text: Duke Xian of Jin granted Zhao Su Geng.

Zhao Su, in the sixteenth year of Duke Xian of Jin, attacked Huo, Wei, and Geng, and Zhao Su served as general attacking Huo. The Lord of Huo fled to Qi. Jin suffered a great drought, they divined it, saying 'Mount Tai of Huo is causing the trouble.' They had Zhao Su summon the Lord of Huo from Qi and restore him, to maintain the sacrifices to Mount Tai of Huo, and Jin again became fertile. Duke Xian of Jin granted Zhao Su Geng.

sentences.zh: 夙生共孟，當魯閔公之元年也。

translations.text: Su gave birth to Gong Meng, during the first year of Duke Min of Lu.

sentences.zh: 共孟生趙衰，字子餘。

translations.text: Gong Meng gave birth to Zhao Shuai, courtesy name Zi Yu.
Su gave birth to Gong Meng, during the first year of Duke Min of Lu. Gong Meng gave birth to Zhao Shuai, courtesy name Zi Yu.

sentences.zh: 趙衰卜事晉獻公及諸公子，莫吉；

translations.text: Zhao Shuai divined serving Duke Xian of Jin and the various princes, none were auspicious;

sentences.zh: 卜事公子重耳，吉，即事重耳。

translations.text: divining serving Prince Chong Er was auspicious, so he served Chong Er.

sentences.zh: 重耳以驪姬之亂亡奔翟，趙衰從。

translations.text: Chong Er fled to the Di due to the Li Ji disturbance, Zhao Shuai followed.

sentences.zh: 翟伐廧咎如，得二女，翟以其少女妻重耳，長女妻趙衰而生盾。

translations.text: The Di attacked Mao Jiu Ru, obtained two women, the Di married the younger daughter to Chong Er, the elder daughter to Zhao Shuai who gave birth to Dun.

sentences.zh: 初，重耳在晉時，趙衰妻亦生趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊。

translations.text: Initially, when Chong Er was in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Ying Qi.

sentences.zh: 趙衰從重耳出亡，凡十九年，得反國。

translations.text: Zhao Shuai followed Chong Er in exile, altogether nineteen years, and returned to the state.

sentences.zh: 重耳為晉文公，趙衰為原大夫，居原，任國政。

translations.text: Chong Er became Duke Wen of Jin, Zhao Shuai became minister of Yuan, resided in Yuan, managed state affairs.

sentences.zh: 文公所以反國及霸，多趙衰計策，語在晉事中。

translations.text: The reasons Duke Wen returned to the state and became hegemon were mostly Zhao Shuai's strategies, as recorded in the Jin affairs.

Zhao Shuai divined serving Duke Xian of Jin and the various princes, none were auspicious; divining serving Prince Chong Er was auspicious, so he served Chong Er. Chong Er fled to the Di due to the Li Ji disturbance, Zhao Shuai followed. The Di attacked Mao Jiu Ru, obtained two women, the Di married the younger daughter to Chong Er, the elder daughter to Zhao Shuai who gave birth to Dun. Initially, when Chong Er was in Jin, Zhao Shuai's wife also gave birth to Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Ying Qi. Zhao Shuai followed Chong Er in exile, altogether nineteen years, and returned to the state. Chong Er became Duke Wen of Jin, Zhao Shuai became minister of Yuan, resided in Yuan, managed state affairs. The reasons Duke Wen returned to the state and became hegemon were mostly Zhao Shuai's strategies, as recorded in the Jin affairs.

sentences.zh: 趙衰既反晉，晉之妻固要迎翟妻，而以其子盾為適嗣，晉妻三子皆下事之。

translations.text: After Zhao Shuai returned to Jin, Jin's wife insisted on welcoming the Di wife, and established her son Dun as the proper heir, Jin's wife's three sons all served him below.

sentences.zh: 晉襄公之六年，而趙衰卒，謚為成季。

translations.text: In the sixth year of Duke Xiang of Jin, Zhao Shuai died, posthumously titled Cheng Ji.

After Zhao Shuai returned to Jin, Jin's wife insisted on welcoming the Di wife, and established her son Dun as the proper heir, Jin's wife's three sons all served him below. In the sixth year of Duke Xiang of Jin, Zhao Shuai died, posthumously titled Cheng Ji.

sentences.zh: 趙盾代成季任國政二年而晉襄公卒，太子夷皋年少。

translations.text: Zhao Dun succeeded Cheng Ji in managing state affairs for two years when Duke Xiang of Jin died, Crown Prince Yi Gao was young.

sentences.zh: 盾為國多難，欲立襄公弟雍。

translations.text: Dun, because the state had many difficulties, wanted to establish Duke Xiang's younger brother Yong.

sentences.zh: 雍時在秦，使使迎之。

translations.text: Yong was then in Qin, sent envoys to welcome him.

sentences.zh: 太子母日夜啼泣，頓首謂趙盾曰：「先君何罪，釋其適子而更求君？」

translations.text: The crown prince's mother day and night wept, kowtowing to Zhao Dun saying: 'What crime did my late lord commit, abandoning his proper son and seeking another lord?'

sentences.zh: 趙盾患之，恐其宗與大夫襲誅之，乃遂立太子，是為靈公，發兵距所迎襄公弟於秦者。

translations.text: Zhao Dun was troubled by this, fearing his clan and the ministers would attack and execute him, so he established the crown prince, this was Duke Ling, and sent troops to block those welcoming Duke Xiang's younger brother from Qin.

sentences.zh: 靈公既立，趙盾益專國政。

translations.text: After Duke Ling ascended, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized state affairs.

Zhao Dun succeeded Cheng Ji in managing state affairs for two years when Duke Xiang of Jin died, Crown Prince Yi Gao was young. Dun, because the state had many difficulties, wanted to establish Duke Xiang's younger brother Yong. Yong was then in Qin, sent envoys to welcome him. The crown prince's mother day and night wept, kowtowing to Zhao Dun saying: 'What crime did my late lord commit, abandoning his proper son and seeking another lord?' Zhao Dun was troubled by this, fearing his clan and the ministers would attack and execute him, so he established the crown prince, this was Duke Ling, and sent troops to block those welcoming Duke Xiang's younger brother from Qin. After Duke Ling ascended, Zhao Dun increasingly monopolized state affairs.

sentences.zh: 靈公立十四年，益驕。

translations.text: Duke Ling ascended for fourteen years, becoming increasingly arrogant.

sentences.zh: 趙盾驟諫，靈公弗聽。

translations.text: Zhao Dun repeatedly remonstrated, Duke Ling did not listen.

sentences.zh: 及食熊蹯，胹不熟，殺宰人，持其尸出，趙盾見之。

translations.text: When eating bear paw, it was not cooked thoroughly, he killed the cook, held the corpse out, Zhao Dun saw it.

sentences.zh: 靈公由此懼，欲殺盾。

translations.text: Duke Ling from this became fearful, wanting to kill Dun.

sentences.zh: 盾素仁愛人，嘗所食桑下餓人反捍救盾，盾以得亡。

translations.text: Dun was always benevolent and loved people, once a hungry person he fed under the mulberry tree later defended and saved Dun, Dun thereby escaped.

sentences.zh: 未出境，而趙穿弒靈公而立襄公弟黑臀，是為成公。

translations.text: Before leaving the borders, Zhao Chuan assassinated Duke Ling and established Duke Xiang's younger brother Hei Tun, this was Duke Cheng.

sentences.zh: 趙盾復反，任國政。

translations.text: Zhao Dun returned again, managed state affairs.

sentences.zh: 君子譏盾「為正卿，亡不出境，反不討賊」，故太史書曰「趙盾弒其君」。

translations.text: The gentleman criticizes Dun 'as chief minister, in exile did not leave the borders, returning did not punish the traitor', therefore the Grand Historian wrote 'Zhao Dun assassinated his lord.'

sentences.zh: 晉景公時而趙盾卒，謚為宣孟，子朔嗣。

translations.text: During Duke Jing of Jin's time Zhao Dun died, posthumously titled Xuan Meng, son Shuo succeeded.

Dun was always benevolent and loved people, once a hungry person he fed under the mulberry tree later defended and saved Dun, Dun thereby escaped. sentences.zh: 趙朔，晉景公之三年，朔為晉將下軍救鄭，與楚莊王戰河上。

translations.text: Zhao Shuo, in the third year of Duke Jing of Jin, Shuo served as Jin's lower army general to save Zheng, battled Chu King Zhuang on the river.

sentences.zh: 朔娶晉成公姊為夫人。

translations.text: Shuo married Duke Cheng of Jin's elder sister as wife.
Zhao Shuo, in the third year of Duke Jing of Jin, Shuo served as Jin's lower army general to save Zheng, battled Chu King Zhuang on the river. Shuo married Duke Cheng of Jin's elder sister as wife.

sentences.zh: 晉景公之三年，大夫屠岸賈欲誅趙氏。

translations.text: In the third year of Duke Jing of Jin, minister Tu An Jia wanted to execute the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 初，趙盾在時，夢見叔帶持要而哭，甚悲；

translations.text: Initially, when Zhao Dun was alive, he dreamed of Shu Dai holding his waist and crying, very sorrowful;

sentences.zh: 已而笑，拊手且歌。

translations.text: then laughed, clapped hands and sang.

sentences.zh: 盾卜之，兆絕而後好。

translations.text: Dun divined it, the omen was broken then good.

sentences.zh: 趙史援占之，曰：「此夢甚惡，非君之身，乃君之子，然亦君之咎。

translations.text: Zhao historian Yuan interpreted it, saying: 'This dream is very bad, not for your body, but for your son, yet it is also your fault.'

sentences.zh: 至孫，趙將世益衰。」

translations.text: To the grandson, the Zhao lineage will increasingly decline.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈者，始有寵於靈公，及至於景公而賈為司寇，將作難，乃治靈公之賊以致趙盾，遍告諸將曰：「盾雖不知，猶為賊首。

translations.text: Tu An Jia, initially favored by Duke Ling, by Duke Jing's time Jia was Minister of Justice, about to create disorder, so he investigated Duke Ling's assassins to implicate Zhao Dun, widely told the generals: 'Though Dun did not know, he was still the head of the traitors.'

sentences.zh: 以臣弒君，子孫在朝，何以懲罪？

translations.text: With ministers assassinating their lord, descendants in court, how to punish crime?'

sentences.zh: 請誅之。」

translations.text: Please execute them.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥曰：「靈公遇賊，趙盾在外，吾先君以為無罪，故不誅。

translations.text: Han Jue said: 'Duke Ling encountered assassins, Zhao Dun was abroad, my late lord considered him innocent, therefore did not execute.'

sentences.zh: 今諸君將誅其後，是非先君之意而今妄誅。

translations.text: Now you gentlemen will execute his descendants, this is not my late lord's intention but now rashly executing.'

sentences.zh: 妄誅謂之亂。

translations.text: Rash execution is called chaos.'

sentences.zh: 臣有大事而君不聞，是無君也。」

translations.text: Ministers have great matters but the lord does not hear, this is having no lord.'

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈不聽。

translations.text: Tu An Jia did not listen.

sentences.zh: 韓厥告趙朔趣亡。

translations.text: Han Jue told Zhao Shuo to quickly flee.

sentences.zh: 朔不肯，曰：「子必不絕趙祀，朔死不恨。」

translations.text: Shuo refused, saying: 'You must not cut off the Zhao sacrifices, Shuo dies without regret.'

sentences.zh: 韓厥許諾，稱疾不出。

translations.text: Han Jue promised, feigned illness and did not go out.

sentences.zh: 賈不請而擅與諸將攻趙氏於下宮，殺趙朔、趙同、趙括、趙嬰齊，皆滅其族。

translations.text: Jia without permission arbitrarily with the generals attacked the Zhao clan at the Lower Palace, killed Zhao Shuo, Zhao Tong, Zhao Kuo, Zhao Ying Qi, all exterminated their clans.

sentences.zh: 趙朔妻成公姊，有遺腹，走公宮匿。

translations.text: Zhao Shuo's wife was Duke Cheng's elder sister, had a posthumous pregnancy, fled to the palace and hid.

sentences.zh: 趙朔客曰公孫杵臼，杵臼謂朔友人程嬰曰：「胡不死？」

translations.text: Zhao Shuo's guest named Gong Sun Chu Jiu, Chu Jiu told Shuo's friend Cheng Ying: 'Why not die?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「朔之婦有遺腹，若幸而男，吾奉之；

translations.text: Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has a posthumous pregnancy, if luckily a boy, I will support him;'

sentences.zh: 即女也，吾徐死耳。」

translations.text: if a girl, I will slowly die.'

sentences.zh: 居無何，而朔婦免身，生男。

translations.text: After not long, Shuo's wife gave birth, bore a boy.

sentences.zh: 屠岸賈聞之，索於宮中。

translations.text: Tu An Jia heard of it, searched in the palace.

sentences.zh: 夫人置兒叱罅祝曰：「趙宗滅乎，若號；

translations.text: The lady placed the child and cursed the crack diviner saying: 'If the Zhao lineage is extinguished, cry;'

sentences.zh: 即不滅，若無聲。」

translations.text: if not extinguished, make no sound.'

sentences.zh: 及索，兒竟無聲。

translations.text: When searched, the child ultimately made no sound.

sentences.zh: 已脫，程嬰謂公孫杵臼曰：「今一索不得，後必且復索之，柰何？」

translations.text: Already escaped, Cheng Ying told Gong Sun Chu Jiu: 'Now one search did not find, later must search again, what to do?'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「立孤與死孰難？」

translations.text: Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'Establishing the orphan or dying, which is harder?'

sentences.zh: 程嬰曰：「死易，立孤難耳。」

translations.text: Cheng Ying said: 'Dying is easy, establishing the orphan is hard.'

sentences.zh: 公孫杵臼曰：「趙氏先君遇子厚，子彊為其難者，吾為其易者，請先死。」

translations.text: Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'The Zhao clan's late lords treated you generously, you be strong for the hard one, I will do the easy one, please let me die first.'

sentences.zh: 乃二人謀取他人嬰兒負之，衣以文葆，匿山中。

translations.text: So the two plotted to take another's infant child and carry it, clothed in embroidered robe, hid in the mountains.

sentences.zh: 程嬰出，謬謂諸將軍曰：「嬰不肖，不能立趙孤。

translations.text: Cheng Ying went out, falsely told the generals: 'Ying is unworthy, cannot establish the Zhao orphan.'

sentences.zh: 誰能與我千金，吾告趙氏孤處。」

translations.text: Who can give me a thousand jin, I will tell the Zhao orphan's location.'

sentences.zh: 諸將皆喜，許之，發師隨程嬰攻公孫杵臼。

translations.text: The generals all rejoiced, promised him, dispatched troops following Cheng Ying to attack Gong Sun Chu Jiu.

sentences.zh: 杵臼謬曰：「小人哉程嬰！

translations.text: Chu Jiu falsely said: 'Petty man Cheng Ying!'

sentences.zh: 昔下宮之難不能死，與我謀匿趙氏孤兒，今又賣我。

translations.text: Formerly in the Lower Palace difficulty could not die, conspired with me to hide the Zhao orphan child, now again sells me.'

sentences.zh: 縱不能立，而忍賣之乎！」

translations.text: Even if cannot establish, how can bear to sell!'

sentences.zh: 抱兒呼曰：「天乎天乎！

translations.text: Holding the child called: 'Heaven, heaven!'

sentences.zh: 趙氏孤兒何罪？

translations.text: What crime has the Zhao orphan?'

sentences.zh: 請活之，獨殺杵臼可也。」

translations.text: Please let him live, killing Chu Jiu alone is acceptable.'

sentences.zh: 諸將不許，遂殺杵臼與孤兒。

translations.text: The generals did not permit, so killed Chu Jiu and the orphan child.

sentences.zh: 諸將以為趙氏孤兒良已死，皆喜。

translations.text: The generals thought the Zhao orphan was truly dead, all rejoiced.

sentences.zh: 然趙氏真孤乃反在，程嬰卒與俱匿山中。

translations.text: But the Zhao true orphan was actually elsewhere, Cheng Ying ultimately hid with him in the mountains.

Zhao Shuo's wife was Duke Cheng's elder sister, had a posthumous pregnancy, fled to the palace and hid. Zhao Shuo's guest named Gong Sun Chu Jiu, Chu Jiu told Shuo's friend Cheng Ying: 'Why not die?' Cheng Ying said: 'Shuo's wife has a posthumous pregnancy, if luckily a boy, I will support him;' if a girl, I will slowly die.' After not long, Shuo's wife gave birth, bore a boy. Gong Sun Chu Jiu said: 'Establishing the orphan or dying, which is harder?' Cheng Ying said: 'Dying is easy, establishing the orphan is hard.' sentences.zh: 十八年，延陵鈞率師從相國信平君助魏攻燕。

translations.text: Afterwards, Zhao Dao Xiang Wang again sent Li Mu to attack Yan, captured Wu Sui and Fang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 秦拔我榆次三十七城。

translations.text: Lian Po was dismissed as commoner.

sentences.zh: 十九年，趙與燕易土：以龍兌、汾門、臨樂與燕；

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: Knowing death is certain yet brave, bravery means though dead still alive.

sentences.zh: 燕以葛、武陽、平舒與趙。

translations.text: Li Mu served as Zhao general, stationed on the border, the army market rents all he used to feed his soldiers.

Crosses the river and dies, what can we do for sir!" Afterwards, Zhao Dao Xiang Wang sent Yue Cheng to replace Lian Po, broke Yan army at Xiang. Yan general Gong Sun Cao killed Dao Xiang Wang. Afterwards, Zhao Dao Xiang Wang again sent Li Mu to attack Yan, captured Wu Sui and Fang Cheng. Lian Po was dismissed as commoner. The Grand Historian says: Knowing death is certain yet brave, bravery means though dead still alive. Li Mu served as Zhao general, stationed on the border, the army market rents all he used to feed his soldiers.

sentences.zh: 二十年，秦王政初立。

translations.text: Rewards and punishments decided externally, not from central oversight.

sentences.zh: 秦拔我晉陽。

translations.text: Delegated authority and held responsible for success, therefore Li Mu was able to exhaust his intelligence and ability, selecting 1,300 chariots, 13,000 crossbow cavalry, 100,000 elite troops.

Rewards and punishments decided externally, not from central oversight. Delegated authority and held responsible for success, therefore Li Mu was able to exhaust his intelligence and ability, selecting 1,300 chariots, 13,000 crossbow cavalry, 100,000 elite troops.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，孝成王卒。

translations.text: Therefore north he drove away the Shan Yu, broke Dong Hu, extinguished Dan Lin,

sentences.zh: 廉頗將，攻繁陽，取之。

translations.text: west he pressed strong Qin, south propped up Han and Wei.

sentences.zh: 使樂乘代之，廉頗攻樂乘，樂乘走，廉頗亡入魏。

translations.text: At this time, Zhao nearly became hegemon.

sentences.zh: 子偃立，是為悼襄王。

translations.text: Afterwards when Qin surrounded Handan urgently, Li Mu arrived, Qin army retreated.

Therefore north he drove away the Shan Yu, broke Dong Hu, extinguished Dan Lin, west he pressed strong Qin, south propped up Han and Wei. At this time, Zhao nearly became hegemon. Afterwards when Qin surrounded Handan urgently, Li Mu arrived, Qin army retreated.

sentences.zh: 悼襄王元年，大備魏。

translations.text: When Qin surrounded Handan and those who died numbered over 200,000.

sentences.zh: 欲通平邑、中牟之道，不成。

translations.text: Li Mu one sortie, Qin army retreated fifty li.
When Qin surrounded Handan and those who died numbered over 200,000. Li Mu one sortie, Qin army retreated fifty li.

sentences.zh: 二年，李牧將，攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.text: Afterwards Zhao king Qian did not use Li Mu, finally broke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 秦召春平君，因而留之。

translations.text: Li Mu died, Zhao perished.

sentences.zh: 泄鈞為之謂文信侯曰：「春平君者，趙王甚愛之而郎中之，故相與謀曰『春平君入秦，秦必留之』，故相與謀而內之秦也。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says: With Li Mu's worthiness, Zhao king Qian did not use him, broke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 今君留之，是絕趙而郎中之計中也。

translations.text: Zhao perished, Qian destroyed himself.

sentences.zh: 君不如遣春平君而留平都。

translations.text: Qian was hostage in Qin, Qin king made him Yang An Jun.

sentences.zh: 春平君者言行信於王，王必厚割趙而贖平都。」

translations.text: Qin king sent Qian to strike Yan Ying, Qian did not go.

sentences.zh: 文信侯曰：「善。」

translations.text: Qin king made Qian crown prince.

sentences.zh: 因遣之。

translations.text: Then sent him away.

sentences.zh: 城韓皋。

translations.text: Walled Han Gao.

Afterwards Zhao king Qian did not use Li Mu, finally broke Zhao. Li Mu died, Zhao perished. The Grand Historian says: With Li Mu's worthiness, Zhao king Qian did not use him, broke Zhao. Zhao perished, Qian destroyed himself. Qian was hostage in Qin, Qin king made him Yang An Jun. Qin king sent Qian to strike Yan Ying, Qian did not go. Qin king made Qian crown prince. Then sent him away. Walled Han Gao.

sentences.zh: 三年，龐煖將，攻燕，禽其將劇辛。

translations.text: Third year, Pang Juan led, attacked Yan, captured their general Ju Xin.

sentences.zh: 四年，龐煖將趙、楚、魏、燕之銳師，攻秦蕞，不拔；

translations.text: Fourth year, Pang Juan led Zhao, Chu, Wei, Yan's elite troops, attacked Qin Zhui, did not capture it;

sentences.zh: 移攻齊，取饒安。

translations.text: shifted to attack Qi, took Rao An.

sentences.zh: 五年，傅抵將，居平邑；

translations.text: Fifth year, Fu Di led, resided at Ping Yi;

sentences.zh: 慶舍將東陽河外師，守河梁。

translations.text: Qing She led Dongyang Hedong troops, guarded He Liang.

sentences.zh: 六年，封長安君以饒。

translations.text: Sixth year, enfeoffed Chang'an Jun with Rao.

sentences.zh: 魏與趙鄴。

translations.text: Wei gave Ye to Zhao.

Third year, Pang Juan led, attacked Yan, captured their general Ju Xin. Fourth year, Pang Juan led Zhao, Chu, Wei, Yan's elite troops, attacked Qin Zhui, did not capture it; shifted to attack Qi, took Rao An. Fifth year, Fu Di led, resided at Ping Yi; Qing She led Dongyang Hedong troops, guarded He Liang. Sixth year, enfeoffed Chang'an Jun with Rao. Wei gave Ye to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 九年，趙攻燕，取貍、陽城。

translations.text: Ninth year, Zhao attacked Yan, took Li and Yang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 兵未罷，秦攻鄴，拔之。

translations.text: Troops not yet withdrawn, Qin attacked Ye, captured it.

sentences.zh: 悼襄王卒，子幽繆王遷立。

translations.text: Dao Xiang Wang died, son You Mu Wang Qian ascended.
Ninth year, Zhao attacked Yan, took Li and Yang Cheng. Troops not yet withdrawn, Qin attacked Ye, captured it. Dao Xiang Wang died, son You Mu Wang Qian ascended.

sentences.zh: 幽繆王遷元年，城柏人。

translations.text: You Mu Wang Qian first year, walled Bo Ren.

sentences.zh: 二年，秦攻武城，扈輒率師救之，軍敗，死焉。

translations.text: Second year, Qin attacked Wu Cheng, Hu Zhe led troops to rescue it, army defeated, died there.
You Mu Wang Qian first year, walled Bo Ren. Second year, Qin attacked Wu Cheng, Hu Zhe led troops to rescue it, army defeated, died there.

sentences.zh: 三年，秦攻赤麗、宜安，李牧率師與戰肥下，卻之。

translations.text: Third year, Qin attacked Chi Li and Yi An, Li Mu led troops and fought them at Fei, repelled them.

sentences.zh: 封牧為武安君。

translations.text: Enfeoffed Mu as Wu An Jun.

sentences.zh: 四年，秦攻番吾，李牧與之戰，卻之。

translations.text: Fourth year, Qin attacked Fan Wu, Li Mu fought them, repelled them.
Third year, Qin attacked Chi Li and Yi An, Li Mu led troops and fought them at Fei, repelled them. Enfeoffed Mu as Wu An Jun. Fourth year, Qin attacked Fan Wu, Li Mu fought them, repelled them.

sentences.zh: 五年，代地大動，自樂徐以西，北至平陰，臺屋墻垣太半壞，地坼東西百三十步。

translations.text: Fifth year, Dai territory greatly shook, from Le Xu westward, north to Ping Yin, towers houses walls mostly destroyed, ground cracked east-west 130 paces.

sentences.zh: 六年，大饑，民訛言曰：「趙為號，秦為笑。

translations.text: Sixth year, great famine, people falsely said: 'Zhao will wail, Qin will laugh.

sentences.zh: 以為不信，視地之生毛。」

translations.text: If you do not believe, look at the ground growing hair.'

Fifth year, Dai territory greatly shook, from Le Xu westward, north to Ping Yin, towers houses walls mostly destroyed, ground cracked east-west 130 paces. Sixth year, great famine, people falsely said: 'Zhao will wail, Qin will laugh. If you do not believe, look at the ground growing hair.'

sentences.zh: 七年，秦人攻趙，趙大將李牧、將軍司馬尚將，擊之。

translations.text: Seventh year, Qin attacked Zhao, Zhao great general Li Mu, general Sima Shang led, struck them.

sentences.zh: 李牧誅，司馬尚免，趙怱及齊將顏聚代之。

translations.text: Li Mu executed, Sima Shang dismissed, Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju replaced them.

sentences.zh: 趙怱軍破，顏聚亡去。

translations.text: Zhao Cong's army broken, Yan Ju fled away.

sentences.zh: 以王遷降。

translations.text: King Qian surrendered.

Seventh year, Qin attacked Zhao, Zhao great general Li Mu, general Sima Shang led, struck them. Li Mu executed, Sima Shang dismissed, Zhao Cong and Qi general Yan Ju replaced them. Zhao Cong's army broken, Yan Ju fled away. King Qian surrendered.

sentences.zh: 八年十月，邯鄲為秦。

translations.text: Eighth year tenth month, Handan became Qin.
Eighth year tenth month, Handan became Qin.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰。

translations.text: The Grand Historian says.

sentences.zh: 吾聞馮王孫曰：「趙王遷，其母倡也，嬖於悼襄王。

translations.text: I heard Feng Wang Sun say: 'Zhao king Qian, his mother was a singing girl, favored by Dao Xiang Wang.

sentences.zh: 悼襄王廢適子嘉而立遷。

translations.text: Dao Xiang Wang deposed rightful son Jia and established Qian.

sentences.zh: 遷素無行，信讒，故誅其良將李牧，用郭開。」

translations.text: Qian originally had no conduct, believed slander, therefore executed his good general Li Mu, used Guo Kai.'

sentences.zh: 豈不繆哉！

translations.text: Was this not absurd!

sentences.zh: 秦既虜遷，趙之亡大夫共立嘉為王，王代六歲，秦進兵破嘉，遂滅趙以為郡。

translations.text: Qin having captured Qian, Zhao's fugitive officials together established Jia as king, reigned in Dai for six years, Qin advanced troops broke Jia, then extinguished Zhao to make it a commandery.

The Grand Historian says. I heard Feng Wang Sun say: 'Zhao king Qian, his mother was a singing girl, favored by Dao Xiang Wang. Dao Xiang Wang deposed rightful son Jia and established Qian. Qian originally had no conduct, believed slander, therefore executed his good general Li Mu, used Guo Kai.' Was this not absurd! Qin having captured Qian, Zhao's fugitive officials together established Jia as king, reigned in Dai for six years, Qin advanced troops broke Jia, then extinguished Zhao to make it a commandery.
